definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: The only problem is that it's fragile and brittle, and that means it breaks easily.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的毛病在于它脆弱而易碎，也就是说很容易坏掉。

sentences.english: One time, the public security door of our building was broken.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，我家楼的公共防盗门坏掉了。

sentences.english: This car is a real lemon. It has broken down four times.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车太次了，已经坏掉四次了。

sentences.english: Any fool can tell this fruit has gone bad.
sentences.chinese: 任谁都看得出这水果已经坏掉了。

sentences.english: I must have my broken watch repaired.
sentences.chinese: 我必须要叫人修我的坏掉的表。

sentences.english: Firstly, my electric rice cooker didn't work suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 第一是因为俺家电饭锅突然就坏掉了哈。

sentences.english: Ex:Can you fix the broken clasp on my necklace?
sentences.chinese: 你能修理我项炼上坏掉的扣环吗？

sentences.english: The landlord has refused to repair a broken air-conditioner.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝修理坏掉的空调。

sentences.english: A battered Model T steering wheel is her garage doorstop.
sentences.chinese: 她车库的制门器是一个坏掉的福特T型车方向盘。

sentences.english: The telephone was knocked off the table and broken.
Sometimes when cars get destroyed, the engine gets destroyed right along with it.
sentences.chinese: 有时候汽车遭到毁坏，发动机也会跟着坏掉。

sentences.english: You can’t leave anything out because it will spoil.
sentences.chinese: 你不能把任何东西留在外面，因为它会坏掉。

sentences.english: This broken watch is still under guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 这只坏掉的表仍在保证期限内。

sentences.english: Have you take a look at your old, broken-down car recently?
sentences.chinese: 最近有检查你那部坏掉的老轿车吗？

sentences.english: When his sled broke down, he repaired it.
sentences.chinese: 当他的雪橇坏掉时，他自己维修。

sentences.english: What's wrong with the light bulb in the study room?
sentences.chinese: 阅读室的灯泡怎么坏掉了？

definition: to have sth go wrong/to have a problem arise/to give problems
to repair (sth broken)/to restore (sth damaged)/to establish friendly relations with/(literary) to do meritorious deeds
to short-circuit/(fig.) to have a mental lapse/to get one's wires crossed/to be addled
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to have water get in (one's ear, shoes etc)/to get flooded/inflow of water
to repair/to fix/to prune/to trim/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
